main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Manston, England on July 6, 1954, by a reliable source with considerable flying experience.
interesting points: The sighting lasted 6-8 seconds and involved one white object seen through the window of an aircraft.
The object ascended almost vertically until it disappeared at an extremely high speed, making it too fast to follow.
The observer is considered a reliable source with a considerable flying experience.
The local meteorological station reported neither the presence of unusual weather phenomena nor the release of weather balloons that could have been mistaken for a flying object.
The report concludes that there is insufficient information to offer an explanation that would preclude considerable doubt.
witnesses: reliable source with considerable flying experience
